Economics.1:
Develop written and oral communication skills: Demonstrate ability to
communicate economic knowledge through written and oral communication.
Economics.2:
Access existing knowledge: Familiarity with reputable resources containing
economic information.
Economics.3:
Demonstrate an understanding of the institutions involved in policy‐making:
Understand the role of major economic institutions involved in policymaking.
Economics.4:
Demonstrate logical reasoning and critical thinking: Demonstrate the ability
to articulate problems and conduct economic analysis in a logical manner
with the use of critical thinking.
Economics.5:
Display command of existing knowledge: Integrate economic knowledge from
multiple areas for application to economic problems.
Economics.6:
Interpret existing knowledge: Demonstrate a command of economic theory
and analytical techniques sufficient to analyze and interpret economic issues.
Economics.7:
Interpret and analyze economic data: Identify and use data to conduct
economic research.
Economics.8:
Apply existing knowledge: Integrate and apply existing economic analysis to
current economic problems or problems, issues, policies.
Economics.9:
Create new knowledge: Use economics skills, methods, and techniques to
create a scholarly product.
